summary: The video explores the political nature of fashion, showcasing traditional Palestinian embroidery and weaving techniques. It highlights how women in Palestine are using these crafts to create clothing and support their families, offering them economic independence and a sense of community in the face of political challenges and the separation wall.
transcript: Is fashion political? Where fashion brand out of Palestine and we work with women and family owned businesses all across Palestine. They're experts in weaving, hand embroidery, and tailoring. The women that we work with, who are experts in hand embroidery and tailoring. We went from working with three embroiderers to now nearly 30. The important thing is that these women don't work in workshops. They work from home. They have complete freedom to decide how they spend their days and work is not the center of their lives, community is. And we share meals with them, cups of coffee. The point being that they are revolutionaries in the face of capitalism, which strives to dehumanize them. These are some of the pieces that we've made together recently. So after learning about the political reality that these women work in to make these garments, you tell me?
